dmca.title: [EV1-C1532209X] UNAUTHORIZED USE OF NATASHA YI'S IMAGE
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please be advised that our customer has notified us that access to the
content that was referenced in your DMCA complaint (attached below) has
been disabled.

Legal Response Team

-----Original Message-----

David K. Caplan
Keats McFarland & Wilson LLP
9720 Wilshire Blvd., Penthouse Suite
Beverly Hills, CA 90212
(310) 248-3830
Fax:  (310) 860-0363 
 
October 25, 2006 
 
VIA ELECTRONIC MAIL  
 
Alexandra Marcus
48TH ST # 168
Miami, FL 33166 
 
support@scanlover.com; admin@evl.net; abuse@ev1servers.net; noc@ev1.net 
 
 
        Re:         UNAUTHORIZED USE OF NATASHA YI'S IMAGE 
        http://www.scanlover.com 
 
Dear Sir or Madam: 
 
        This letter is being written to you on behalf of our client
Natasha Yi.  Ms. Yi is the owner of rights of publicity and privacy in
her name and image.  
 
        Notwithstanding Ms. Yi's rights, it has come to our attention
that your web site located at "http://scanlover.com/natasha-yi,"contains
unauthorized reproductions of Ms. Yi's image.  The distribution of these
images, as well as the use of Ms. Yi's name in metatags on your web site
and/or your use of Ms. Yi's name to increase traffic to your web site,
violates Ms. Yi's rights of publicity and privacy.  Further, based on
the fact that some of the images on the above-referenced web site appear
to have been illegally copied from copyrighted photographs, this web
site may also infringe the rights of various copyright owners. 
 
        We hereby demand that you and all those who have acted in
concert with you immediately cease any copying, transmission, or other
utilization of Ms. Yi's name and image, and that you delete from your
site or other sites operated by you all unauthorized depictions of Ms. 
Yi.  Should you not immediately do so, Ms. Yi expressly reserve all of
its rights to file a lawsuit against you to obtain both damages for all
past acts of infringement and an injunction to prevent any future
infringement. 
         
        If we do not receive your written confirmation before the close
of business on November 1, 2006, that you have complied with these
demands, we will advise Ms. Yi to take such action against you as she
may deem appropriate. 
 
        This letter is not a complete statement of Natasha Yi's rights
in connection with this matter, and nothing contained herein constitutes
an express or implied waiver of any rights, remedies or defenses of
Natasha Yi in connection with this matter, all of which are expressly
reserved. 
 
 
Very truly yours,
/s/
David K. Caplan
Keats McFarland & Wilson LLP
